Text:
(We can transfer magic to our bodies and weapons to
strengthen them. However, there will be some level of
inefficiency as magic moves from one form to another)

(For example, when I transfer 100 currents of magic
to an average steel sword, only 10% of the energy
can be used in combat. A whopping 90% is lost.)

(That's when slimes caught my eye. A slime is a
magical being that uses energy to change form
and wobble from place to place.)

(According to my research, I've found they have a
conductivity of an astonishing 99%. On top of that,
they're in a liquid state, which means they can
change their shape at will.)

I'm liking this slime sword. It's handier than I
expected.

(I got a little too carried away with slashing and
slicing around me, and now it's gone all silent.)
Wait, is there only one guy left?

Eh, I guess you'll be my guinea pig for what comes
next.

If you hang in there, I bet you'll live for, like,
two extra minutes.
S-Stop playing, you brat!

The bandit boss kicks up dust as he uses magic to
close the distance.

To Cid, the swing is clumsy and slow. He didn't even
bother to dodge it.

Not so tough now. I'll have you know that I've
mastered the Bushin method!
Ta-daa!
Wh-What?!
Cid rises to his feet as if nothing happened.
You didn't even last two minutes.

Cid has successfully molded the slime into a wearable
bodysuit, which is both easy to handle and durable.

(It's super-lightweight and silent, unlike armor.
Plus, it almost, like, supports my movements?)
Yeah, I couldn't be happier with my slime bodysuit.
I've avenged you, dead merchants.

Now you can rest easy, knowing your keepsakes will be
put to good use.

(Artwork? I can't sell that. Hard pass on food. Come
on. Where are the cash, jewels, and precious metals?
Gimme, gimme, gimme.)

(I gather my haul and pray in silence. I'm guessing I
found about five million Zeni. One Zeni is more or
less equal to one Japanese yen.)

(All this will help fund my activities as a
shadowbroker.)

(You know, the world would be a much better place if
it were overrun by criminals.)

Oh, how I wish life were like a video game and I
could encounter more enemies just by walking
down the street.)
There's cash, jewels, food, and...
...a cage?

Did they have slaves? Eh, hard pass on anything I
can't trade for cash...

But what if there's something valuable inside?
I lift its cover.
(...Well, this is unexpected.)
It's not a corpse. Rotting, yes, but it's alive.
Is it one of the "possessed"?

(I've heard of the Church executing these creatures.
I think they're called the "possessed.")

(They're born as normal humans, but out of nowhere,
they transform into a cursed mass of rotting flesh.)

(They're fated for death, but the Church goes out of
its way to purchase them, executing them in the name
of purification.)

(They claim to be exorcising demons, but they're
really just murdering the sick. But the ignorant
masses applaud and praise them for keeping
peace on Earth.)

(It's just as you'd expect from the Middle Ages.
What a friggin' downer. I bet I'd get more Zeni
than this entire load of goods if I were to sell this to
the Church.)
(But that's pointless to say since I can't sell it.)
Well, I guess I should put it out of its misery.

Hm? This wavelength...feels familiar. It's the same
as a magical overload.

(I've suffered its effects firsthand. If I hadn't
gotten it under control back then, I might've
ended up suffering the same fate.)

(I know magic has certain effects on the body, which
I felt all too well that fateful day.)

(I sense the potential to raise my tolerance for magic
and allow me to handle more of it.)

(But it's too dangerous to induce a magical overload,
so I toss the idea.)
Haha.

(But if I were to hypothetically conduct experiments
on a product of this phenomenon...)

(then I can get closer to becoming a shadowbroker
without any risks.)
I can use...this flesh.
I mean, it isn't my body, so I can go buck wild.

(And so, I spend my days pumping the flesh with
magical energy,)

(...testing this and that. In all honesty,
it's pretty fun.)

(After all, one of my greatest joys in life is the
sense that I'm getting closer to the essence
of magic and watching my power grow
before my eyes.)
(Wow, it's been a whole month, huh...?)
//Movie Play
Huh? My body! How?!

You've been cured of your curse...
You're a free elf now.
You...cured me... Wait, what "curse"?
Right, you see...

You descendants of the heroes suffer from a terrible
curse.

(I mean, when you get to my level, twisting out a
scenario from a legend is a piece of cake.)

I get your surprise, but I'm sure you've heard the
story.

You know, the story of how three brave warriors
destroyed Diablos and protected the world.
That really happened.

Just before the demon's death, with his very last
breath, he put a curse on them—the curse that
transformed you into a mound of flesh.

But there's someone out there who twisted history,
labeling your kind as the possessed—
Targets of shame.
What...!?
As for the identity of these masterminds...
...Yes...these masterminds...

...will have to remain nameless for now. Knowing
their identity will put you in danger...
I don't mind! Who are they...?
Huh...? I see...in that case, I'll tell you...
Cid grins as he comes up with an idea.

The Cult of Diablos—those who scheme to resurrect
the demon Diablos.

They only work behind the scenes, which is why we
must hide in the shadows to thwart their ambitions...
I guess.
By the way, my name is Fancy—uh...

My name is Shadow. I lurk in the darkness and hunt
down shadows.
Our journey may be perilous. But we must go forward.

Child of heroes, are you prepared to walk alongside
me?

I lost everything the day the disease... I mean, curse
ravaged my body.

You saved my deformed, rotting flesh from its
inevitable fate.

So...if that's what you want, then I'll devote my
life to it. We'll...punish those sinners with death!
(Obviously, I made everything up on the spot.)
Cid fist pumps in his mind.
(Whoo-hoo! This elf girl is super-gullible!)

(Obviously, the Cult of Diablos doesn't exist, which
means we'll never find them.)

(But, it provides grounds for me to accuse and
slaughter any thief syndicate in the area for
being in the Cult. And I bet we can covertly
intervene in other people's battles.)

(And—and we can say fake-deep stuff for our parting
words! Like "The end is near..." or "The resurrection
of the demon is nigh...")
(Wow. I could honestly go on and on.)

I'm guessing our enemies hold positions of formidable
power and the hordes of people under their control
don't know the truth...
Still...

there will be no mercy for those who stand in our
way.
Yeah, something like that.

We'll also need to track down and protect the other
descendants of heroes.
Uh, yeah, sure.

Then there's expanding our organization and
establishing our base. It'll require raising
capital...
Great, just don't go overboard.
Okay, let's see...

The name of our organization is Shadow Garden,
and you can call yourself Alpha.
//ムービ再生（アルファ獲得）
Have you noticed something, Alpha?
Huh...?
They're outside.
They? You mean friends of the bandits?!

I'm guessing it's the main party. They probably came
to check since the others didn't return.
Be careful. They're no ordinary bandits.
You mean—?!
It's the Cult of Diablos disguised as bandits!

It all makes sense! Attacking the merchants was just
a ruse. Their true target was the possessed—me!
Urk... They had me completely fooled.
Yeah, something like that.

(I'll put the bandits to good use as assassins from
the Cult of Diablos.)

Since this is the main party, they'll be stronger than
the others.
No problem. They still have no idea how strong we are.

I see—a surprise attack. In that case, let's hide in
the shadows back there.

It's a blind spot from the entrance, and we'll be
able to see everything from there—the perfect
position to catch them by surprise.
Y-Yeah, good point.

(This girl's surprisingly crafty and quick on
her feet.)
...So that's the Cult of Diablos.

What a convincing disguise—they look just like
bandits. I'd never have guessed if you hadn't
told me.
Y-Yup.
Come, let's go. Shadow Garden's first battle begins.

I will carve those sinners up with my blade of
vengeance and punish them with death!
